thread.title: California district agrees to clean up contaminated water
thread.title_full: California district agrees to clean up contaminated water

title: California district agrees to clean up contaminated water
text: California district agrees to clean up contaminated water By Associated Press | September 15, 2015 @ 3:44 pm FILE - In this June 25, 2013, file photo, workers move irrigation pipes from a field in the Westlands Water District near Five Points, Calif. Westlands Water District agreed to spend more than $2.7 billion to clean up contaminated water in California's fertile Central Valley in a settlement agreement to be announced Tuesday, Sept. 15, 2015, drawing criticism from members of Congress who say the deal was forged in secrecy, wipes away large amounts of debt and hands over greater control of California's scarce water supplies to the nation's largest irrigation district. (AP Photo/Gosia Wozniacka,File)
